If you have sensitive skin, it's important to assess the reaction of the sunscreen on your skin to determine if it's causing any adverse effects. Here are some signs that a sunscreen may be causing a reaction on your sensitive skin:

1. Redness: If your skin becomes red or inflamed after applying sunscreen, it may be a sign of an allergic reaction.

2. Itchy skin: If your skin feels itchy or irritated after applying sunscreen, you may be experiencing an adverse reaction to the product.

3. Rash: If red or irritated areas appear in a rash-like pattern, it may be due to an allergic reaction to the sunscreen.

4. Breakouts or acne: Some sunscreens contain ingredients that can trigger an acne flare-up, which can be problematic for sensitive skin types.

5. Sensitivity to light: If your skin is more sensitive to light than normal, you may be experiencing a reaction to the sunscreen.

If you experience any of these symptoms after using a new sunscreen, stop using the product immediately and wash the area with mild soap and water. If the reaction persists, consult a dermatologist for appropriate treatment options.
